result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy A. Saavedra

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy A. Saavedra in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Jeremy A. Saavedra.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy A Saavedra in court, in custody by video. Attorney Obi Uzowulu appeared specially. Defendant is on PO hold. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Jeremy A Saavedra in court, in custody by video. Attorney Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant spoke with SPD and says he has Attorney Uzowulu. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH E.J. OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
